A pizza is typically prepared by spreading tomato sauce on a flat dough base and then adding toppings such as cheese, vegetables, and meats before baking it in an oven.

Pizza is typically prepared with dough, tomato sauce, cheese, and various toppings such as vegetables, meats, and herbs. The dough is usually stretched or rolled out, then topped with sauce, cheese, and other toppings. The pizza is then baked in an oven until the cheese is melted and the crust is golden brown.
